Title: Hello!
Summary: Hello! You're seeing first post on this website! You're going to see more of them!

Article.p: Hello! You're seeing first post on this website! You're going to see more of them! Because I'm taking webpage design, you're going to see the journal posts, which you may share with others. Also, this is an opportunity for us to show our creativity. You're going to see many diverse journal entries later. Make a great day!

Title: Opinion about Motivational Phrases
Summary: You're going to learn about my stance on topic about motivational bracelets.

Article.div.accordion#accordionExample:
These motivational bracelets about memorising positivity related quotes.

I have chosen the quote about never stopping action of learning. There's a saying about that.

The takeaway is that you can wear these kind of bracelets, nobody stops you from that, of course. The meaning of quote about learning as lifetime process is important because we're learning via trial and errors. You don't have to wear that all the time, because you're still going to memorise quotation well. As a summary, you may be choosing bracelet with any quotation as you please, because it's your and only your choice.

Title: School without rules
Summary: What if the school you attend did not have any rules and rulemakers? You will know briefly answers on this question

Article.div.accordion#accordionExample:
Schools, as any other place, have certain rules and constraints to ensure everyone's safe and not endangered.

If we removed the rules and rulemakers altogether, there would be possible scenarios (depending on various factors):

  • Nobody would be bound to the school rules anymore.
  • Most of students would no longer follow the rules because the safeguards are void now.
  • Some teachers would still follow the rules which are technically void.

However, this kind of freedom would have a collosal cost in terms of property/monetary/injury-like damages, similar to:

  • School owned property — most of that could be damaged
  • Many people could be injured or even [censored].

However, this lawlessness would not last longer than several days, assuming school's district's rules still apply and state/federal laws still apply:

  • Within few minutes/hour after the chaos, the local county police department would come swiftly
  • Several people could be hospitalised
  • School and/or school district could be sued for property damage/bodily injury
  • Newspapers, local or national, are likely broadcast about lawlessness to the internet and social media
  • School would definitely be forced to reinstance rules to comply with applicable laws or shutdown and ask students to transfer to different school.

The takeway is inspired from the Civics topc about limiting the power of the government. The rules at school behave similarly to the laws of the governmental entity. These constraints exist to prevent the state of nature where nobody would be safe. Thus, the conclusion is that we need at least some kind of government.
